Title:
A new species of Uleiorchis (Orchidaceae, Gastrodieae) from
the Atlantic Forest of Brazil
Keywords:
Gastrodia, nrITS, molecular phylogenetics,
mycoheterotrophy, ParanÃ¡
Abstract:
A new species from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest,
Uleiorchis prataÃ«nsis, is described, with illustrations and scanning
electron micrographs of pollinaria and seeds. Comments on the new
species are presented with a key to the species of the genus. We
estimated phylogenetic relationships using nrITS sequence data to
confirm that this species is a member of Gastrodieae. The results
indicate with high support in both maximum parsimony (MP) and
maximum-likelihood (ML) analyses that it is a member of this tribe.
Finding a new species in a relatively well-collected place such as
ParanÃ¡ State supports the status of high diversity hotspot for the
Atlantic Forest and demonstrates the need for more fieldwork on orchids
and other families.
